meanings.sent1: Brecciation can create interesting patterns in rocks.
meanings.sent2: Geologists study brecciation to understand how different rocks are formed.
meanings.sent3: During the brecciation process, rocks get a makeover!

meanings.definition: The act of breaking or fracturing rocks into angular fragments.
meanings.sent1: Heavy pressure can cause brecciation in rocks.
meanings.sent2: The brecciation of the boulder resulted in sharp-edged fragments.
meanings.sent3: The brecciation of the rock was so loud, it sounded like a drum solo!
meanings.sent4: The brecciation of the cliff face revealed its ancient history.
meanings.sent5: The brecciation of the stone created a jigsaw puzzle of pieces.

meanings.definition: The formation of a rock composed of angular fragments cemented together.
meanings.sent1: Brecciation can lead to the creation of unique rock formations.
meanings.sent2: The brecciation of the sedimentary rock made it strong and durable.
meanings.sent3: The brecciation of the pebbles made them stick together like glue!
meanings.sent4: The brecciation of the stone wall gave it a rugged appearance.
meanings.sent5: The brecciation of the boulder made it resemble a patchwork quilt.
